channel.title: Stories Podcast: A Bedtime Show for Kids of All Ages
channel.description: On the Stories Podcast, we perform a new story for your children every week. The stories range from retellings of fairy tales like Snow White to classic stories like Peter Rabbit and even completely original works. Everything is G rated and safe for all ages. The perfect kids podcast for imaginative families. Whether you’re driving with your children or just want to limit your kids’ screen time, Stories Podcast delivers entertainment that kids and parents alike will love.
channel.itunes:author: Stories Podcast / Wondery

Whether you’re driving with your children or just want to limit your kids’ screen time, Stories Podcast delivers entertainment that kids and parents alike will love.

image.title: Stories Podcast: A Bedtime Show for Kids of All Ages

item.title: Smash and Grab at the Dollhouse
item.description:
Today's story is about a couple of mice named Tim and Hunny. They were new parents and their baby was having trouble sleeping. Thinking that their baby might be in need of some solid food, and not having any around to give him, they head over to their neighbors house to ask for help. Follow along to find out how the mice finally get their baby to sleep.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

Check out our new YouTube channel at youtube.com/storiespodcast. If you've ever wanted to read along with our stories, now you can! These read-along versions of our stories are great for early readers trying to improve their skills or even adults learning English for the first time. Check it out.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Singing Sparrow
item.description:
Today's story is about a bossy little bird named Betty. Betty thought she was in charge of everyone and everything and was always bossing everyone around. Listen along to find out how she learns a valuable lesson.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Winnie The Pooh's Party
item.description:
Christopher Robin is throwing a party for Pooh, for being the best bear in all the world, and also for being a hero and saving Piglet from the big flood. Join us for this wonderful celebration of Pooh!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Stories Podchats: Halloween Candy Bracket
item.description:
Today's Episode is our very first video podchats episode!!! Join us on YouTube https://youtu.be/X3FidYIV0P0 to watch, and don't forget to like and subscribe, our YouTube channel has tons of awesome content. Today we're doing a bracket on the best Halloween Candy, follow along to find out what Kelsie, Amanda, and Brock Rackets decide is the best Halloween candy.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Duckbill's Dew
item.description:
Today's story is about a bush plane pilot named Mallory “Mallard” McCoy. Listen along as Mallory and his trusty DHC-2, lovingly named Duckbill's Dew, are hired to perform a daring rescue.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Poison Apple: A Spellbinders Story
item.description:
Today's episode is the second in a new and exciting series call The Spellbinders, brought to you by Molly Murphy and the team at Dorktales Storytime. Follow along as Alice and Octavia go on another fun filled adventure in search of magical items that are born from powerful stories.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Thor and the Stolen Hammer
item.description:
Today's episode is about everyone's favorite Norse god Thor. Thor has his beloved hammer Mjölnir stolen from him in the night. Follow along to find out how he gets it back with the help of his uncle the trickster god Loki.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: Flopsy Bunnies
item.description:
Today's story is about a family of bunnies called the Flopsies. Follow along as Benjamin and his kids find themselves in a tight spot after falling asleep while eating scraps in Farmer McGregor's trash heap.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Peter and Penny Rabbit - Sleep Series
item.description:

item.title: The Little Acorn - Rebroadcast
item.description:
The air has changed and Mother Oak knows that it's finally the season for all her acorn babies to fall out of the tree and make their own way in the world. But the littlest acorn, Hazel, is scared! Can she just stay an acorn on her branch forever, please?

item.title: Cap The Coolest Capybara
item.description:
Today's episode comes to us courtesy of friend of the show Will Martin. Cap the Capybara is the chillest animal in the whole rain forest, and he throws the best parties around. Cap gets along with almost everyone because he's such a nice guy, follow along to find out how he wins over yet another friend among the animals of the rain forest.

item.title: Croc and Plover
item.description:
Today's story is a tale about a gigantic crocodile named Mash. Mash was this biggest, meanest croc in the Nile, and he could eat anything. Unfortunately Mash has a toothache and he doesn't know what to do about it, since the human dentist are terrified of him, and none of the other animals trust him enough to get near his mouth. Follow along to find out what happens.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Marathon
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Cock a Doodle Dude
item.description:
Today's story is an adaptation of a Greek myth. The Greek God of war Ares was predictably at war and he gave his top lieutenant Alectryon an important task: to wake Ares and the entire army at dawn. Follow along to find out what happens when Alectryon decides he would rather have fun and stay up all night.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: A Watched Pot

item.title: Bearly a Dog
item.description:
Today's story is about a dog named Princess Alabaster Mackenzie the Fifth who had a very privileged life living with her humans. Despite how well she was treated though Ali thought there might be something better out there for her in the forests of the mountain she lived on, on the other side of her fenced in yard. Follow along as she finds out just how good she had it back at home.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: The Dragon's Hoard
item.description:
Today's story is about a city at the foot of a mountain that is being plagued by a great and terrible dragon. Follow along as the city folk learn that separately and divided they are powerless but together and united they can do anything.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Winnie the Pooh and Eeyore's Lost Tail
item.description:
Today's episode is another story about the hundred acre wood and that wonderful honey obsessed bear Winnie the Pooh. In this story Pooh Bear finds out that Eeyore has lost his tail and sets out to find it for him.

item.title: Alexander and the Great Mistake
item.description:
Today's episode comes to us from Jacob Rozencwaig, the host of the Curious Kid Podcast. In this episode we tell the amazing story of Alexander Fleming and the mistake he made that turned out to be so great that it revolutionized all medicine, and saved countless lives.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.description:

item.description:
Today's episode is brought to us by the team at the Little Kids, Big Hearts podcast. Follow along as Crayton the dragon and his adopted sibling Kaze learn some tough lessons about being kind to friends and family and sticking up for others in need.

item.title: Apollo: Dragon and Dolphin
item.description:
Today's episode is an adaptation of a Greek myth. Zeus is once again meddling in the affairs of his children. This time Apollo is in his sights. Follow along as Apollo fights a dragon and establishes his first temple in Greece.

item.title: Kongji and Patji
item.description:
Today's story is about a young girl named Kongji who lived in a small village in Korea. Kongji had a pretty mean step-mother and step-sister and they treated her poorly even though she was such a kind and caring girl. Follow along as Kongji gets the help she needs because of all the good deeds and help she had given in the past.

item.description:

item.title: Burrito the Donkey
item.description:
Today's episode is an adaptation of an aesop's fable in which a father and daughter are taking their donkey into town to go to the farmer's market and buy some rhubarb. Along the way the father learns that you can't try to make everyone happy or you'll just end up making no one happy.

item.title: Tumble en Espanol: ¿Qué pasaría si no hubiera Luna?
item.description:
¿Alguna vez te has preguntado qué pasaría si de repente la Luna desapareciera? Resulta que la Luna es mucho más importante para la vida del planeta Tierra de lo que pensamos. El ingeniero aeroespacial Miquel Sureda nos explica cómo se formó la Luna hace millones de años. Además, nos cuenta cómo los científicos miden la distancia entre la Luna y la Tierra descubriendo así que se está alejando poco a poco de nosotros.

What would happen if our Moon suddenly disappeared? Would we still have tides? It turns out that the Moon has a much bigger influence on Earth than you might think. Without the Moon, life as we know it would not exist! Rocket scientist Miquel Sureda explains what happened before the Moon existed, and how we know that the Moon is slowly moving away from us.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Starsworn: Max Goodname and the Hidden Conservatory Part 2
item.description:
Today we're not just telling a story, we're playing a game that will teach you how to tell stories of your own at home. Starsworn is a game we designed with Michael Low from Luck of Legends. Take on the role of heroes in a world of wonder! In Starsworn, kids and parents get the chance to build worlds, create heroes, and go on adventures together.

In today's episode Max Goodname and the gang manage to find the information they need in the library of the conservatory. As they are about to embark on a journey to Bastion, on one of Lady Bronzewynne's airships, they are visited by a familiar adversary who has sabotaged the ship's controls.

if you want to play along at home, there’s a free story that’s different than the one in this episode, available to download at StoriesRPG.com.

And to check out all of Vindsvept’s music, head to youtube.com/vindsvept!

Special thanks to Nate, Emily, and Kelsie Lee, our producer Andrew Martin, our friend Vindsvept who wrote all the original music in the episode, and Michael Low, the designer of the Starsworn game with Daniel Hinds. Michael is a certified English teacher who runs online classes to help kids learn the joy of writing fiction by using story-telling games. If you’d like to hear your kids laugh, gasp in excitement, and write page after page of stories for the sheer joy of it, check out the classes on LuckOfLegends.com. Classes count for homeschool credit and come with Common Core aligned feedback on your child’s writing, speaking, and collaboration skills, so you can help them keep growing as they play!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

Today we're not just telling a story, we're playing a game that will teach you how to tell stories of your own at home. Starsworn is a game we designed with Michael Low from Luck of Legends. Take on the role of heroes in a world of wonder! In Starsworn, kids and parents get the chance to build worlds, create heroes, and go on adventures together.

In today's episode Max Goodname and the gang manage to find the information they need in the library of the conservatory. As they are about to embark on a journey to Bastion, on one of Lady Bronzewynne's airships, they are visited by a familiar adversary who has sabotaged the ship's controls.

if you want to play along at home, there’s a free story that’s different than the one in this episode, available to download at StoriesRPG.com.

item.title: New Youtube Channel
item.description:
Hello! We wanted to let you all know that we’ve just launched our official youtube channel at youtube.com/storiespodcast. If you’ve ever wanted to read along with us, these videos are just for you! They feature the text of the stories nice and large on the screen, with each word highlighted as I read it so you can match up the way it looks with the way it sounds! Youtube also lets you change the play speed, so depending on your level, you can slow down the narration to follow along. They’re great for new readers, storybook time, English language learners, and even just for listening! 


In the future, we plan on adding more read-alongs, some live storytime readings, Q+As and more!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: One Big Mitten
item.description:
Today's story is an old classic Ukrainian Folktale. A little boy named Olek wanted to go out and play during one of the coldest winters in memory. He ends up losing a mitten in the woods, follow along to find out what happens to his mitten before Olek and his Baba can find it the next day.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Wanda Walgood, Wandering Witch (rebroadcast)
item.description:
Today's story is a rebroadcast of a fan favorite. Wanda Walgood is a very good little witch, except for one thing: Her aunts can never get her to study! Then they send her on a quest to retrieve an old wizard's lost library. Will Wanda finally learn to appreciate books??

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Beaver Bridger Builder
item.description:
Today's episode is about a colony of beavers living in a deep piece of forest, and of course, they had their river. Some young kits were swimming across a particularly swift and dangerous part of the river to get to an apple tree grove. Follow along as an older and wiser beaver named Stamps tries to help them cross more safely. 

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Dragon's Gifts
item.description:
Today's episode is the story that we based our live show on. On yule tide eve, Twins Marta and Kurt climb up a mountain in search of gifts that are said to have been frozen there along with a dragon long ago. Follow along as they make friends and get help along the way. 

If you would like to check out our live video performance of this story from our holiday special, along with games, songs, and a live Q&A it's still available at live.storiespodcast.com.

item.title: New Years Goblins
item.description:
Today's episode is about the Kallikantzaroi…also known as the New Years Goblins. They spent most of the year underground but they were allowed on the surface only twelve days, between Christmas and the Epiphany on January Sixth, also known as the twelve days of Christmas. Listen along to see what kind of mischief the goblins get up to and how a boy and his grandma manage to protect their candy shop.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: No Place Like Home
item.description:
Today's story is set in ancient Greece and is about a water nymph named Chelone. She was shy and an introvert, which means she preferred time alone, quiet, and by herself. Listen along as Chelone ends up teaching the greek gods a lesson, and her punishment winds up being a fantastic gift in her eyes.  

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Starsworn: Max Goodname and the Frog Witch Part 2
item.description:
Today we're not just telling a story, we're playing a game that will teach you how to tell stories of your own at home. Starsworn is a game we designed with Michael Low from Luck of Legends. Take on the role of heroes in a world of wonder! In Starsworn, kids and parents get the chance to build worlds, create heroes, and go on adventures together.

In today's episode Max Goodname and the gang meet the frog witch, a mystical hermit who lives in the southern swamp. Max, Corly, and Wallace learn what their star signs mean, and what their Starsworn powers are.

if you want to play along at home, there’s a free story that’s different than the one in this episode, available to download at StoriesRPG.com.

And to check out all of Vindsvept’s music, head to youtube.com/vindsvept!

Special thanks to Nate, Emily, and Kelsie Lee, our producer Andrew Martin, our friend Vindsvept who wrote all the original music in the episode, and Michael Low, the designer of the Starsworn game with Daniel Hinds. Michael is a certified English teacher who runs online classes to help kids learn the joy of writing fiction by using story-telling games. If you’d like to hear your kids laugh, gasp in excitement, and write page after page of stories for the sheer joy of it, check out the classes on LuckOfLegends.com. Classes count for homeschool credit and come with Common Core aligned feedback on your child’s writing, speaking, and collaboration skills, so you can help them keep growing as they play!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: The Bell of Atri
item.description:
Today's episode is an adaptation of an Italian fable, all about a busy old town in Italy called Atri. It was a very nice place to live so the town grew and grew until eventually there were so many people that the courthouse was completely overwhelmed with everyone's issues. Listen along to find out how the King decided to make sure everyone got the justice they deserved in a very unconventional way. 

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.description:

item.title: King of Beasts
item.description:
Today's story is about an impending battle between the Bears and the Lions. Both sides thought that they should be the king of the beasts. Listen along to find out how King Kalvin of the Lions managed to get an edge in the battle by relying on some unlikely allies.

item.title: Starsworn: Max Goodname and the Frog Witch Part 1
item.description:
Today we're not just telling a story, we're playing a game that will teach you how to tell stories of your own at home. Starsworn is a game we designed with Michael Low from Luck of Legends. Take on the role of heroes in a world of wonder! In Starsworn, kids and parents get the chance to build worlds, create heroes, and go on adventures together.

In today's episode Max Goodname and the gang arrive in Mendwell and speak to lore mother Wynds. When she learns about what happened on the iron penance she sends the gang on a journey to find the frog witch in the southern swamp. Along the way they learn how the star fall has been effecting the kingdom. 

if you want to play along at home, there’s a free story that’s different than the one in this episode, available to download at StoriesRPG.com.

And to check out all of Vindsvept’s music, head to youtube.com/vindsvept!

Special thanks to Nate, Emily, and Kelsie Lee, our producer Andrew Martin, our friend Vindsvept who wrote all the original music in the episode, and Michael Low, the designer of the Starsworn game with Daniel Hinds. Michael is a certified English teacher who runs online classes to help kids learn the joy of writing fiction by using story-telling games. If you’d like to hear your kids laugh, gasp in excitement, and write page after page of stories for the sheer joy of it, check out the classes on LuckOfLegends.com. Classes count for homeschool credit and come with Common Core aligned feedback on your child’s writing, speaking, and collaboration skills, so you can help them keep growing as they play!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Pull Pull Pull My Cart!
item.description:
Today's Story is about a pony named Clover. She belonged to a farmer and she would pull his cart to the market in the glen each weekend. Follow along as Clover has a hard time pulling an extra heavy cart to the market, laden down with practically the whole fall harvest.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: The Trojan War Part 2: Achilles Heel and the Trojan Horse
item.description:
Today's episode is an adaptation of a Greek myth that we're doing in 2 parts. Part 1 was published earlier this week so go back and check it out. In part 2 we hear about the war between the Greeks and the Trojans, don't miss the exciting conclusion!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Trojan War Part 1: To the Most Beautiful
item.description:
Today's episode is an adaptation of a Greek myth that we're doing in 2 parts. In part 1 we hear about the wedding of Peleus and Thetis. Eris, the goddess of chaos, was not invited to the wedding precisely because she couldn't help but cause trouble and chaos wherever she went. However, when she found out she wasn't invited, she managed to cause quite a bit of chaos anyway.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.content:encoded:
Today's episode is an adaptation of a Greek myth that we're doing in 2 parts. In part 1 we hear about the wedding of Peleus and Thetis. Eris, the goddess of chaos, was not invited to the wedding precisely because she couldn't help but cause trouble and chaos wherever she went. However, when she found out she wasn't invited, she managed to cause quite a bit of chaos anyway.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT: 2021 Holiday Charity Livestream!
item.description:
We're excited to announce that we'll be doing a live holiday season performance this year. We'll be performing a brand new holiday story, playing games, singing songs, and doing a live audience Q&A. Join us at 6:00pm on Sunday December 19th for a fun filled event full of holiday cheer.

Tickets start at $5 per household and all proceeds are being donated to purchase holiday gifts and meals for families in need. Your ticket will allow you to join us live or if it doesn't work for your schedule you can also play the show back later when it's a better time for you.

got to live.storiespodcast.com for tickets and more details.

item.title: Insults and Antlers
item.description:
Today's episode is about a majestic stag named Randall. Randall considered himself the lord of the forest and would hold court at a still pool in the heart of the forrest. Follow along as Randall learns how to deal with his insecurities and finds out that sometimes what you think is a flaw might just be your best feature. 

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Treemaster Trophy
item.description:
Today's episode is about the great, the ultimate, the prestigious: Treemaster Trophy lumberjack contest. All the greatest lumberjacks of the forest come together for this contest every year. Listen along to find out how a surprising new contestant, who no one has heard of before, manages to win the whole thing. 

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Of Soldiers and Supper
item.description:
Today's episode is about a colony of mice who are under some questionable leadership. Preparation for winter is under way and the colony is unsure if they'll be able to have enough food to last. Listen along to find out how the leaders decide to handle the situation.

item.title: Starsworn: Max Goodname and the Iron Penance
item.description:
Today we're not just telling a story, we're playing a game that will teach you how to tell stories of your own at home. Starsworn is a game we designed with Michael Low from Luck of Legends. Take on the role of heroes in a world of wonder! In Starsworn, kids and parents get the chance to build worlds, create heroes, and go on adventures together. Today's Max Goodname story will be told by playing this new game.

if you want to play along at home, there’s a free story that’s different than the one in this episode, available to download at StoriesRPG.com.

Special thanks to Nate, Emily, and Kelsie Lee, our producer Andrew Martin, our friend Vindsvept who wrote all the original music in the episode, and Michael Low, the designer of the Starsworn game with Daniel Hinds. Michael is a certified English teacher who runs online classes to help kids learn the joy of writing fiction by using story-telling games. If you’d like to hear your kids laugh, gasp in excitement, and write page after page of stories for the sheer joy of it, check out the classes on LuckOfLegends.com. Classes count for homeschool credit and come with Common Core aligned feedback on your child’s writing, speaking, and collaboration skills, so you can help them keep growing as they play!

And to check out all of Vindsvept’s music, head to youtube.com/vindsvept!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: My Brother, the Baba Yaga, and Me
item.description:
Today's story is adapted from a Russian folktale. A little girl named Yana was a terribly picky eater. Yana's parents ask her to watch her little brother one day and it all goes terribly wrong. Follow along to hear about Yana's wild adventure and an encounter with the Baba Yaga.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Goblin Wedding
item.description:
Today's episode is about a young woman named Lutsi and her fried Rolli the mouse. Lutsi had always dreamed of getting married and having a big fancy wedding but it didn't matter much to her who would be the groom. Follow along as Lutsi finds out sometimes you should be careful what you wish for.

item.title: Sour Grapes
item.description:
Today's Story is an adaptation of an Aesop’s Fable about a fox named Fina. Fina has a bit of a sweet tooth and is looking for some fruit to eat instead of the normal worms or mice or frogs. Follow along as she tries to get her paws on some sweet smelling grapes she finds growing near her home.

item.title: Too Many Chefs
item.description:
Today's episode is about an aspiring chef named Jaye who is taking a test to become a real chef at her favorite restaurant. Jaye's friends and coworkers give her more advice than she bargained for. Follow along to find out if she manages to pass the test and become a chef.

Draw us a picture of what you  think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in  it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share  it on our feed!!

item.title: Little Thieves
item.description:
Today's Story is an adaptation of an old folk tale about a mouse and his mother. They live in the basement of an elementary school and have plenty of crumbs and other leftovers to eat after the kids make a mess in the cafeteria. Unfortunately little Micah gets a little too greedy with the cafeteria food and makes a big mistake. 

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Half Full
item.description:
Today's story is about a pair of twins, Devin and Dara. The twins had pretty much the same day but despite that one twin has a great day, and the other one not so much. Listen along to find out why!

Draw us a picture of what you  think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in  it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share  it on our feed!!

item.title: The Lambton Dragon
item.description:
Today's story is about John and how a poor decision he makes as a kid ends up coming back to him many years later. Listen along as John takes responsibility for his mistakes and does his best to make them right again.

item.title: Stories Podchats: Would You Rather
item.description:
Today we’re sharing an episode of Stories Podchats with a fun game for you to play along at home. We will be playing a game called would you rather, where our guests will have to choose between 2 difficult scenarios. If you're having fun playing along with us we are posting part 2 with lots of additional questions on our Patreon so head over to patreon.com/stories for more would you rather questions. For more episodes of Stories Podchats, and for ad-free episodes, access to all of our ebooks, or to receive a thank you in a future episode, you can check us out on patreon.com/stories.

item.title: My Three Witches
item.description:
Today's episode is about a little girl named Beanie who dreamed of being a witch. Beanie tries to help and learn from three local witches, but it doesn't always go so well. Tune in to find out if Beanie ever gets to become a witch.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Alfred's New Audience
item.description:
Alfred loves playing the piano, but he misses having his family around to play for. When the neighbors upstairs have a baby that cries ALL the time, it gets even harder for Alfred to enjoy his piano time! How will he make this situation work? Listen in and find out!


Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Geese Who Saved Rome
item.description:
Regina knows that she and the other geese are good at their job, guarding the pond by the temple for the Roman goddess Juno. But the eagles and the wolf-dogs seem to think that you can't be good at being a guard if you also spend some of your time chasing after bits of bread and playing in the water. Are they right??

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.itunes:title: The Geese Who Saved Rome
item.itunes:summary:
Regina knows that she and the other geese are good at their job, guarding the pond by the temple for the Roman goddess Juno. But the eagles and the wolf-dogs seem to think that you can't be good at being a guard if you also spend some of your time chasing after bits of bread and playing in the water. Are they right??
Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!
If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

Regina knows that she and the other geese are good at their job, guarding the pond by the temple for the Roman goddess Juno. But the eagles and the wolf-dogs seem to think that you can't be good at being a guard if you also spend some of your time chasing after bits of bread and playing in the water. Are they right??

item.title: Thief and Saint
item.description:
Thief and Saint is a story about Chet and Amos, two ne'er-do-wells in the wild west. Listen along and learn that your attitude towards those around you can make all the difference, and it's never too late to change your ways. 

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Soft: The First Dog (complete)
item.description:
It's Memorial Day Weekend! If you're going on trips and taking long drives, you need longer stories to listen to. Today we're sharing a longer story that was originally told in three parts in 2017, all edited together for your listening pleasure! Please enjoy "Soft: The First Dog" the story of how humans and dogs first became friends. (Please note: This story might be more appropriate for some of our older listeners, about 7 and up!) We'll be back with new stories next week. Enjoy the long weekend!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: Chasing Squirrels
item.description:
Charlie the dog is so excited for the first walk of spring! The sights! The smells! The squirrels! His human, Jane, has to remind him that it's NOT okay to chase them, but when one of the squirrels steals his peanut butter treat, Charlie can't help himself. What kind of trouble will this very good boy get into?

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: The Boiled Frog
item.description:
Frug the frog isn't suspicious when he meets the chef, and he's not suspicious when the chef runs a hot bath for him. He's not even suspicious when he realizes there are carrots and onions floating around in the tub with him! But will Frug start to catch on when the water around him starts to get hotter and hotter? Tune in to find out!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: Tumble: Do Trees Fart?
item.description:
This week we join Co-hosts Lindsay and Marshall of Tumble the science podcast for kids. Tumble starts with questions from kids and then explores stories of science and discovery. In this episode the three year old daughter of a plant biologist asks... Do trees fart?

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Grass is Always Greener
item.description:
When Beverly the bunny sees the grass in her neighbor's yard, she's convinced that it's greener. The old badger says that grass always looks greener on the other side, but Beverly's not sure she believes him. She has to go check anyway! What do you think, is the old badger right? You'll have to listen and see!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: Monkey and the Engineer
item.description:
Jerry the monkey loves train rides with his friend Fuller, the conductor. He loves looking out the windows, he loves all the levers and the buttons, and most of all he loves the throttle. When Fuller pulls the throttle, the train goes fast! Jerry loves to go fast. When Fuller pulls the train in for a pit stop, Jerry is left alone for a minute. Can he resist pulling the throttle? And what will happen if he can't? Tune in to find out!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Wylderwood 2: Chapter One
item.description:
The last we saw Harks, Lochlan, and Nezzy, they were entering the Wylderwood without any of their mentors there to guide them, hoping to carry on the mission their leaders had sacrificed themselves for. But how will they make it without anyone showing them the way? Tune in to the first chapter of Book Two of The Wylderwood find out!

This is the first of six new chapters of The Wylderwood saga, which will be released every other week for the next couple of months. Keep an eye out for more, coming soon!

item.title: Thirsty: A Sheriff James Roberts story from the Wild West
item.description:
Sheriff James Roberts went into the desert with several plans: he would capture the notorious bandits Bradford Brothers, recover the money they stole from the bank, and return to the town of Hayvrill a hero. But now that he's out there under the hot rays of the sun with nothing but sand as far as the eye can see, he has just one goal: to survive.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Who's Afraid of the Monster Under the Bed?
item.description:
Jules does NOT like sleeping in her own bed at night. She's convinced there's a monster underneath it! And one in the closet! And maybe even one in the toybox! How can Jules ever fall asleep when she's convinced she's not alone? Tune in to find out!

item.title: The Kelpie
item.description:
Alec and Gil love to play at the pond near their house, and their mom always says it's okay as long as they promise to never talk to strangers. They're usually good at listening, but when a lady comes and invites them to come pet a wild horse she found, they can't resist! But is this really a good idea? Tune in to find out!

Women’s History Month is a great time to prioritize your self-care. Start with Care/of! For 50% off your first Care/of order, enter code "stories50" at TakeCareOf.com!

item.content:encoded:
Alec and Gil love to play at the pond near their house, and their mom always says it's okay as long as they promise to never talk to strangers. They're usually good at listening, but when a lady comes and invites them to come pet a wild horse she found, they can't resist! But is this really a good idea? Tune in to find out!

Women’s History Month is a great time to prioritize your self-care. Start with Care/of! For 50% off your first Care/of order, enter code "stories50" at TakeCareOf.com!

item.title: African Folktales
item.description:
I want to introduce you to a podcast called African Folktales. My friend Ms. JoJo takes kids on adventures all over Africa in her Magical Jeep to laugh and learn lessons with a fun twist. African Folktales are stories that are told by word of mouth through generations, so each episode is a tale that’s hundreds or even thousands of years old, but Ms. Jo Jo worked a little magic so we can all enjoy them today. Today we are going to hear two stories from Ms. Jo Jo, one called “The Happy Man” and the other called “The Pot of Wisdom”. If you enjoy these podcasts be sure to visit abfc.co/folktales to subscribe and hear more!

And in honor of our partnership, stories podcast is making a donation to https://www.ubongo.org/

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Anansi and the Sky God's Stories
item.description:
Anansi feels bad that humans don't have any stories to tell each other, so he goes to the Sky God to ask for some, but there's a price to pay. The Sky God needs Anansi to complete a long series of difficult challenges, and only then can he have some stories to share! Will he make it? Tune into this West African fable, performed for you by our friend Melly from Stoopkid Stories, to find out!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: My Cat Hippo Part 2
item.description:
Tune in to hear the conclusion to the story of Leah and her cat Hippo.

Leah is sick of being the smallest one in class! Maybe her problems will be solved when she eats the magic cookie her Meemaw bakes to help her grow, but her kitty Hippo gets to it before she can! What will happen now??

item.title: The Fastest Way Down
item.description:
Jasper and Hattie are climbing down a mountain to get to their home in the valley. Hattie knows that you need to go slow when you're on a steep path, but Jasper can see their house in the distance below and he just wants to hurry! But is the fastest way down always the best one? Tune in to find out!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Castle of the Fly
item.description:
Flinch the fly is tired of living outside and getting rained on. As luck would have it, he finds a very cozy sandcastle made by a very small human and moves right on in! If you had the absolute perfect place to live, do you think you would want a roommate? Flinch DEFINITELY does not...

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Fairy's New Year Gift (rebroadcast)
item.description:
Today's story is a New Year's story that we originally released this week FOUR YEARS AGO in 2016!! Can you believe that much time has passed? We sure can't! Say goodbye to 2020 with this adaptation of a story by the American author Emilie Poulsson, and then tune in for more brand new episodes in 2021! 

 

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.description:

item.title: Gibbly and Gibli Go To The Moon
item.description:
Gibbly and Gibli are brothers. Or, maybe cousins? Actually, maybe they're just best friends, but no one really knows. What we DO know is that Gibbly and Gibli have LOTS of big ideas! But can they actually make these ideas happen?


Today's story is a special collaboration with our friend Elliott Kalan! Elliott Kalan is a writer who writes with words. He has written comic books, tv shows, and picture books, and he has won MANY awards for his writing, but he doesn't like to brag about it :) His newest book is called Sharko and Hippo and it would make a great gift for the holiday season. Check it out wherever books are sold!


This month, we'll be donating all the profits from this episode to the Native American Heritage Association, a non-profit organization that provides support to Native American families living on Reservations in South Dakota and Wyoming. For more information about the great work they're doing, visit their website: naha-inc.org.


Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us! 


Thank you!!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Flying South
item.description:
Mallory the duck was well known as the bully of the lake. But her secret was that she was only mean to hide the fact that she was afraid. Will she be able to overcome her fear and survive the winter? Listen in to find out.

item.title: The Boy and the Whale
item.description:
It's Native American Heritage month! So today’s story is a traditional Mi’kmaw story adapted for you by Pamela Palmater and Daniel Hinds! Pam is a member of the Mi’kmaw Nation, which is an Indigenous nation situated in Canada and the US, AND she’s the host of the Warrior Kids Podcast, a great podcast that celebrates everything Indigenous. Check it out wherever you listen to podcasts!

And to further honor Native American Heritage month, we’ll be making a donation to the First Nation Child and Family Caring Society, which advocates on behalf of First Nations children in foster care. You can make a tax deductible donation as well at fncaringsociety.com!



Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us! 


Thank you!!

item.title: The Cats of Ulthar
item.description:
When the cats in Ulthar begin to go missing, everyone KNOWS the creepy Old Cotters are responsible, but no one can prove it. How will the townspeople save their precious feline family members? Find out in this (not-too-spooky) adaptation of an H.P. Lovecraft story!


Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: Sink or Swim, una nueva leyenda de La Llorona
item.description:
Today's episode is special guest story from our friends at Girl Tales! It's written by Monet Hurst-Mendoza, features performances by Jen Anaya, Jacqueline Guillen, Annie Henk, and Benjamin Manno, and is produced by Chad Chenail and executive produced by Rebecca Cunningham.


Girl Tales is a kids' podcast of feminist fairy tales for a new generation. Damsels in distress or princesses in need of protection? Not on Girl Tales! The girls in these stories take control of their own destinies, turning your favorite fairy tales, fables, and myths into exciting new adventures. If you like this episode, you can find more Girl Tales anywhere you listen to podcasts!


Some more good news! The proceeds of this episode this month will go to supporting The Kilroys, a collective of playwrights, directors, and producers taking action to address gender parity in the performing arts field. Check them out at thekilroys.org! 


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us! 


Thank you!!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Clever Wolves
item.description:
Old Pap is a shepherd dog that watches over Lulu the lamb and her friends, and he's pretty strict. When Lulu meets some other dogs, they convince her that they'll be way better watchdogs and she'll have way more fun...if she'll only get rid of Old Pap. Do we think this is a good idea?


Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: The Ginormous Turnip
item.description:
Dadushka is VERY excited for turnip stew, but he can't get the last turnip out of the ground! He needs some help, but are there enough hands in the house to unearth this GINORMOUS turnip?? Tune in to this classic Russian folktale to find out!


Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The New Kid
item.description:
Today's episode is a special collaboration with Melly from Stoopkid Stories! Together, we tell the story of Isabella and Adaliya. When Adaliya and her family move into the neighborhood, Isabella is eager to meet her and introduce her to all the other kids, but...it doesn't quite go the way anyone planned. What went wrong?


The proceeds from today's episode will go to supporting Black Out Collective, a radical, direct action, full-service organization that provides on the ground support, training and deep space visioning in communities that prioritize the liberation of Black people. Check out their website, blackoutcollective.org, to learn more and see how you can support the incredible work they do!


Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.description:

item.title: The Wylderwood: Part Four
item.description:
Parental warning, this episode has some fantasy person on person violence!


When we last saw our heroes, Harks, Nezzy, and Lochlan, they were attending a very exciting meeting in Edgewater. Just when they were going to see what was inside the red coffer, a huge pitwyrm and terrifying dross started to attack! How will they keep each other safe?



Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Straw That Broke the Camel's Back
item.description:
The animals in the desert need to travel to find a new oasis. They haven't had water for days! Ibil the camel is sure that she can help everyone carry their stuff...but can she do it all alone?



Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: Brothers and Bees
item.description:
Manfred is mighty and Kurtz is clever! Jakob has a lot to offer, but when his brothers call him "Jakob the Gentle" they don't mean it like a compliment. But when the princess eats cursed honey, who will save the day?

item.title: Bending and Breaking
item.description:
The old oak tree is strong and sturdy, and he does not like to bend when the winds blow. Bending makes you weak! That's why he thinks the cattail reeds are silly. Why go with the flow when the wind blows when you could just stand still? But when a hurricane comes, the old oak may have to rethink things...



Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: The Great Race of the Chinese Zodiac
item.description:
When the Jade Emperor decides to create a zodiac, he organizes a big race for all the animals to run. Whoever wins will get to represent a year in the zodiac! The cat decides she wants to win, even if it means being mean to her friend the rat. But how will the rat feel about that?


Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Bunny's Big Leap
item.description:
Charlie is a scared little bunny. He's scared of the big bunnies, he's scared of the river where the wild onions grow, and most of all, he's scared of heights. When his nana decides to make her favorite onion soup she needs Charlie's help. Will he finally face his fears??


Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

item.title: The Seal-Skin Girl (2016)
item.description:
We had some technical difficulties with our episode for today, so we're re-releasing this one from 2016! It was originally a two-parter, but we've put it together this time, so it's a longer episode. 


If you're looking for more activities to do at home with your kids, we'd love to see their artwork! If they draw pictures of any of the characters or scenes from our stories, take a picture and tag us in it on Instagram, and then we'll share it on our feed! We're @storiespodcast (and give us a follow while you're at it)! We hope everyone is staying healthy and safe, and we'll be back with a brand new story next week!!


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, or just tell your friends about us! 


Thank you!! Stay safe!!

item.content:encoded:
We had some technical difficulties with our episode for today, so we're re-releasing this one from 2016! It was originally a two-parter, but we've put it together this time, so it's a longer episode. 


If you're looking for more activities to do at home with your kids, we'd love to see their artwork! If they draw pictures of any of the characters or scenes from our stories, take a picture and tag us in it on Instagram, and then we'll share it on our feed! We're @storiespodcast (and give us a follow while you're at it)! We hope everyone is staying healthy and safe, and we'll be back with a brand new story next week!!


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: Songs for Lions
item.description:
Galen and Lydia are enjoying their time traveling together, engaging in lively discussion. Galen, a musician, thinks you never need a weapon when you have music, and Lydia, a soldier, strongly disagrees. Later on, when lions find their cave, who will get to say "I told you so"?

item.title: The Know-It-All
item.description:
Abdul is pretty sure he knows everything. His favorite sayings are "half your life is lost without knowledge" and "well, actually..." (and everyone is pretty sick of hearing them). But what will happen when he spends a week on his uncle's boat? How can he know everything there when he doesn't even know how to sail??

item.title: The Very Sick Goblins
item.description:
Louise the doctor is very excited to take a vacation from curing people, but when she gets kidnapped by some very sick goblins she HAS to help them feel better... or they'll make her into soup!


Fun fact: the song in this episode is just the right length to sing while you wash your hands! If you and your family start using it while you wash, take a video and send it to us on Instagram! We're @storiespodcast. We'd also love to see any drawings you and your kids make of the characters from our stories. Tag us in them and we'll repost on our feed! Stay healthy!!


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: Extra Scoops!
item.description:
We've been working with our friend, journalist Andy Rosen, to make a news show for kids! Today we have an episode for you to check out. It mentions current events and politics, including turkey call champions, Frozen 2, and impeachment.

Subscribe to Extra Scoops: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/extra-scoops/id1489180627

From Extra Scoops!

What would you do if you came across a wild turkey in the woods? We speak to two brothers who are champion turkey callers, who explain everything. We also discuss why grownups are so worked up about what's happening in Washington, and we get a kid's review of Frozen 2.


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, or just tell your friends about us!

item.title: The Pumpkin Seeds
item.description:
Magic pumpkins keep growing in Lakshmi's yard, and she and her brother Dubey can't believe it! 

In this traditional Indian folktale, we find out what happens when you help someone in need out the goodness of your heart and what happens when you help someone in the hopes of getting a reward.

item.title: Getting My Wings
item.description:
Stevie is disappointed when he finds out he’ll have to go to camp this summer. He thought he’d finally have a chance to relax and be himself, but now he’ll have to go on living a “double life”, just like he does during the school year. It’s exhausting! Will this summer be the catastrophe that he’s imagining, or will it finally be the one where Stevie gets his wings? Listen in to this Pride Month story to find out!


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, or just tell your friends about us! Scales the snake wants to win the hugging contest, but nobody will let him enter! Are arms really THAT important for a good hug? Tune in to find out!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five-star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, or just tell your friends about us! You can also check out our sponsor, Monica + Andy at monicaandandy.com!

Now you can find new episodes of Stories, completely ad-free, on Stitcher Premium! For a free month of Stitcher Premium, go to stitcherpremium.com/wondery and use promo code ‘WONDERY’.

item.title: The Little Rescue
item.description:
Ms. Beakman thinks that kindness for kindness sake is important, and Mr. Pecks is not so sure. Who will win this argument? You'll have to listen to find out!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you could leave us a five star review on iTunes, make a monthly donation at patreon.com/stories, or tell a friend about us!

item.title: The Love Potion
item.description:
In this story, based on a traditional Ethiopian fable, a very nervous young man named Abel seeks a magical solution to his struggles, but he needs to retrieve a very special ingredient first! Will he be able to do it? Listen in and find out! And parents, see if you recognize the fun oldie that inspired this episode's song!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, consider checking out one of today's sponsor, Monica + Andy, at monicaandandy.com! You could also leave us a five star review, make a monthly donation at patreon.com/stories, or just tell a friend about us!

item.title: Kiddo and the Fox
item.description:
This is a story about an absent-minded little lamb who follows a butterfly into the woods and finds herself invited to dinner with a fox... as the main course! How is she going to get out of this predicament?? You'll have to listen to find out!


If you would like to support our podcast, you can visit patreon.com/stories and make a pledge. There's a poll up right now about our pledge rewards and we really want your input!!

item.title: The Great Pooka Rescue

item.title: The Silent War for the Open Door
item.description:
The door is open and someone needs to close it. Will Adeena or Hassan cave first? Tune in to find out what happens in this story, adapted from a traditional Pakistani folk tale!

Head to storiespodcast.com/shop to pick up some new Dog King merch and support families in need for the holiday season at the same time! All profits will be donated to a local organization that helps provide for families during this time of year. Listen in for more details at the top of the show!

item.title: My Pet Fairy
item.description:
Today we bring you an original story all about what happens to Nellie when she tries to take a bit of old forest magic, a fairy, and keep it in a jar as a pet. Do you think that sounds like a good idea? You'll have to listen to see what happens!

The conclusion of The Brilliant Firefly: Revolt will be posted next week!

If you'd like to support our podcast, you can visit patreon.com/stories and make a pledge. OR you can support either of this week's sponsors: Daily Harvest and Bombas! When you support our sponsors, you're helping us continue to create new content for you and your family to enjoy! Thank you!

Here are the offer details:

Daily Harvest: Go to Daily-Harvest.com and enter promo code STORIES to get three cups FREE in your first box!

Bombas: Go to Bombas.com/stories and enter the code STORIES to get 20% off your order of the best socks ever!

item.title: The Brilliant Firefly: Revolt, Chapter 9
item.description:
It's the penultimate installment of The Brilliant Firefly: Revolt! In this episode, we finally learn more about Firefly's archenemy: The Scarlet King!

item.title: The Little Dutch Boy
item.description:
Fun Fact: This familiar story about the Little Dutch Boy that saves the Netherlands from a great flood is NOT a real Dutch story, and is actually a piece of American folklore! Origins aside, it contains an important message about sacrificing for the greater good, and a really fun song too!

.

.

item.title: Why the Leaves Change Color (Rebroadcast)
item.description:
This week we bring you the Haudenosaunee (Iroquois Native American) story on why the leaves change color in the autumn. This beautiful story has been passed down through the oral tradition and we've interviewed multiple Haudenosaunee storytellers to bring you the same version members of the Haudenosaunee heard as children. Support the show at Patreon.com/stories!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Thor in the Land of the Giants
item.description:
It was late in the great halls of Asgard. The gods were sleeping...or at least, most of them were. Thor, God of Thunder, strongest warrior to ever walk on earth or in the heavens, was having an argument with Loki, god of fire, and cunning trickster. It had started off innocently enough, but Loki knew just how to get Thor angry. In fact, it was one of his favorite games. “Sorry Thor, but you’re wrong. It is much better to be clever than it is strong.”
Support the show at Patreon.com/stories
See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: The Brilliant Firefly: Reborn Part 2
item.description:
Part two of our superhero origin story. Jillian Jayes was a normal girl. Well, not really, but don't tell her that. She loved nothing more than judo, skipping school, and watching the superheroes fight crime all over Gigacity. But when her father is killed by super villains and her mother insists they move out to the country, she's forced to adjust to small town life. It's tough going, but she soon learns that the smallest towns can hold the biggest secrets.
See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Why the Leaves Change Color - A Traditional Haudenosaunee (Iroquois Native American) Story
item.description:
This week we bring you the Haudenosaunee (Iroquois Native American) story on why the leaves change color in the autumn. This beautiful story has been passed down through the oral tradition and we've interviewed multiple Haudenosaunee storytellers to bring you the same version members of the Haudenosaunee heard as children. Support the show at Patreon.com/stories!
See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.
item.itunes:title: Why the Leaves Change Color - A Traditional Haudenosaunee (Iroquois Native American) Story
item.itunes:summary:
This week we bring you the Haudenosaunee (Iroquois Native American) story on why the leaves change color in the autumn. This beautiful story has been passed down through the oral tradition and we've interviewed multiple Haudenosaunee storytellers to bring you the same version members of the Haudenosaunee heard as children. Support the show at Patreon.com/stories!
See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: The Birth of Christ and Christmas
item.description:
This week, we want to tell you the story about the origin of Christmas. This is a story from the Christian Faith, but it’s cultural impact on the world at large cannot be overstated. So, whether you’re religious or not, there are things to learn and enjoy in this classic story about the birth of a very important little baby. We hope you like it!

item.title: Amazing Grace Princess of Space — Every Creature
item.description:
In the black depths of space, where star ships travel faster than the law, there is a new and wild frontier. Colonists settle strange planets, pirates smuggle exotic goods, and bold heroes eke out livings with the sweat of their brows and the triggers of their blasters. In this brave new world, there is one girl dedicated to protecting the defenseless creatures of the universe.
She is Amazing Grace, PRINCESS….OF….SPACE!

item.title: The Magic Armor - Full Version
item.description:
This version contains parts I and II of our story "The Magic Armor–a Max Goodname Tale." In it, a young squire named Max dreams of knighthood, and he won't let a little thing like having no armor bring him down. In his way stand some of the best warriors in the realm, but with a crafty wizard and a beautiful cleric in his corner, he just may have a chance.
See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: The Magic Armor pt. 2— A Max Goodname Tale
item.description:
The grand finale of The Magic Armor. With the help of Wallace Q. Wallace, Max finally gets his chance to joust. Will he prove his skill and win his knighthood? There's only one way to find out!

item.title: Peter and Penny Rabbit
item.description:
Peter Rabbit and his sister Penny venture into Mr. McGregor's Garden. Will the two naughty little rabbits make it out, or will they end up in a rabbit pie?

item.title: Snow White and the Wicked Witch
item.description:
Our take on the classic tale of the fairest maiden herself, Snow White, inspired by the Brothers Grimm. Beautiful princesses, evil witches, an unlikely hero...and seven more smaller unlikely heroes. What more could you want?
